definition: to form/to organize/group/team/classifier for sets, series, groups of people, batteries

leading small group (LSG), a CCP body that exercises general oversight on matters relating to a specific area (LSG for foreign affairs 外事工作, LSG for comprehensively deepening reforms 全面深化改革 etc)/aka central leading group

sentences.english: How long would it take to assemble a team for a project like this?
sentences.chinese: 为这样一个计划调集一个小组的人需要多长时间？

sentences.english: See it when I was in a two day off-site meeting for the team.
sentences.chinese: 我在一个为期两天小组会议的场外看到的风景。

sentences.english: The negotiating groups have developed consolidated legal text in virtually all negotiating groups.
sentences.chinese: 谈判小组在几乎所有的谈判中均已完成法律文本合并。

sentences.english: My extracurricular activities include the Math and Drama Clubs.
sentences.chinese: 我的课余活动包括参加数学兴趣小组和戏剧社。

sentences.english: My transition team held videoconferences with each regional office.
sentences.chinese: 我的过渡小组与每个区域办事处举办了视频会议。

sentences.english: But be in these not in igneous group.
sentences.chinese: 可是在这些不火的小组里。

sentences.english: They reported this direction to the direction - finding evaluation subsection .
sentences.chinese: 他们把这个方向报告给测向分析小组。
论题或者局域学习小组。

sentences.english: The panel of judges looked through more than 43, 000 entries to this year's competition.
sentences.chinese: 今年评委小组审阅了43000多幅参赛作品。

sentences.english: An investigation team led by the provincial public security department has been formed.
sentences.chinese: 省公安厅为此成立的一个案件调查小组。

sentences.english: But the events have not caught the team unprepared.
sentences.chinese: 不过此次事件并没有超出过渡小组的预期。

sentences.english: A team at U. C. San Diego had been searching for it.
sentences.chinese: 加大圣地牙哥校区的研究小组一直在寻找这个反射器。

sentences.english: Go on learning the text in groups , and translate.
sentences.chinese: 小组内自学课文，熟读并翻译。

sentences.english: The leading group is to move back at5 minutes' notice.
sentences.chinese: 先头小组何时返回，提前五分钟通知。

sentences.english: Last term I took part in a geography research study group.
sentences.chinese: 上学期，我参加了地舆小组的研究性学习。

sentences.english: For that reason, the explosives unit maintains a huge supply of potential bomb making ingredients.
sentences.chinese: 因此，爆破小组保存了许多可能制造炸弹的材料。

definition: to divide into groups/(computer networking) packet
(sports) to go out of bounds/to go over the line/to qualify for the next round of competition/(Tw) (fig.) to make the grade/to achieve success
to form/to organize/group/team/classifier for sets, series, groups of people, batteries
to perform divination with sticks/to draw lots/a ballot (in share dealing)
quota/number of places/place (in an institution, a group etc)
